abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Industrial Sector Adjustment
            Credit Project will support the implementation of a program
            of reforms designed to promote export-oriented private
            sector-led development of the industrial sector. They
            include import liberalization, strengthening of institutions
            involved with export promotion and reforms aimed at
            transforming the regulatory stance of the Government towards
            private sector development to a promotional one. The reform
            program will: (1) increase Bangladesh's competitiveness
            and potential for labor-intensive growth; (2) increase
            producers' ability to respond quickly to changing
            market conditions while reducing opportunities for
            unproductive rent seeking; and (3) enhance the
            Government's capacity for efficient performance in
            policy making and delivering services to export and other
            private producers. Its comprehensiveness is intended to
            facilitate a good supply response to the trade policy reforms.
